definition: naturally-formed feet (as opposed to bound feet 小腳|小脚[xiao3 jiao3])/long kick (soccer)/Bigfoot (mythological animal)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful

sentences.english: Was the Bigfoot mystery finally solved?
sentences.chinese: 大腳怪之謎終於解決了嗎？

sentences.english: Xiao Zhimei served as the general manager of the high champion supermarket, wasteful spending.
sentences.chinese: 蕭芝媚擔任高爾佳超市的總經理後，大手大腳花錢。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold face flower feet still be firm.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金面對花大腳依然態度堅決。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: During the heady years of great economic expansion, many people spent money recklessly.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟大擴張的急進年月，很多人花錢大手大腳。

sentences.english: A cavalier attitude to expenses incensed voters at home.
sentences.chinese: 他在花費支出上的大手大腳令全國選民爲之憤慨。

sentences.english: Big Foot promises the creditors that he will take care of the debt.
sentences.chinese: 大腳答應債主自己會扛下所有的債務。

sentences.english: Nana despises Yijia when she finds out that Big Foot is her father.
sentences.chinese: 娜娜發現大腳是怡嘉的父親後立刻看不起怡嘉。

sentences.english: Hand off first, don't push long passes.
sentences.chinese: 先在後場倒一倒腳，別忙着大腳傳球。

sentences.english: Don't pick fights with guys who make 'Sasquatch' Sam look tiny.
sentences.chinese: 別找讓大腳山姆看起來很迷你的大傢伙們打架。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold in flower bigfoot under persecution finally with the couple.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金在花大腳的逼迫之下終於跟其成婚。

sentences.english: After playing in a movie named A Pair of Beautiful Big Feet , Ni-Ping was well tanned.
sentences.chinese: 演完電影《一雙美麗的大腳》，倪萍被曬黑了。

sentences.english: He is a playboy, and spends money hand-over-fist.
sentences.chinese: 他是個花花公子，花起錢來大手大腳慣了。

sentences.english: Late at night, cheng bite gold and flower feet in bed play play.
sentences.chinese: 深夜，程咬金與花大腳在牀上嘻戲。

sentences.english: Heavy-foot made a derisory noise, proving that he didn't recognize irony when he heard it.
sentences.chinese: 大腳發出了嘲弄的笑聲，證明他根本不懂得反話。

sentences.english: By way of comparison, "Happy Feet" collected nearly $42 million on its opening weekend.
sentences.chinese: 《快樂的大腳2》首周票房成績是4千2百萬。

sentences.english: Sirius Black also known by his nickname Padfoot, was a pure-blood wizard.
sentences.chinese: 小天狼星布萊克綽號“大腳板”，是純血統的巫師。

definition: (fig.) trump card
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
clear and simple/in simple terms
kneecap
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to keep up with the latest fashion
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
mosaic (loanword)/pixelation
fluffy/furry
stallion/stud horse
to fire a gun/to substitute for sb in sitting an examination
my unworthy opinion (humble expr.)
flip-flops
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
brightly colored/gaudy
weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
